scene.title: SCENE I. The British camp, near Dover.

scene-body.stagedir:
Enter, with drum and colours, EDMUND, REGAN, Gentlemen, and Soldiers.
EDMUND Know of the duke if his last purpose hold, Or whether since he is advised by aught To change the course: he's full of alteration And self-reproving: bring his constant pleasure.
[To a Gentleman, who goes out

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Our sister's man is certainly miscarried.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: 'Tis to be doubted, madam.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Now, sweet lord,
You know the goodness I intend upon you:
Tell me--but truly--but then speak the truth,
Do you not love my sister?

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: In honour'd love.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: But have you never found my brother's way
To the forfended place?

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: That thought abuses you.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: I am doubtful that you have been conjunct
And bosom'd with her, as far as we call hers.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: No, by mine honour, madam.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: I never shall endure her: dear my lord,
Be not familiar with her.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Fear me not:
She and the duke her husband!

scene-body.stagedir: Enter, with drum and colours, ALBANY, GONERIL, and Soldiers

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Aside I had rather lose the battle than that sister
Should loosen him and me.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Our very loving sister, well be-met.
Sir, this I hear; the king is come to his daughter,
With others whom the rigor of our state
Forced to cry out. Where I could not be honest,
I never yet was valiant: for this business,
It toucheth us, as France invades our land,
Not bolds the king, with others, whom, I fear,
Most just and heavy causes make oppose.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Sir, you speak nobly.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Why is this reason'd?

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Combine together 'gainst the enemy;
For these domestic and particular broils
Are not the question here.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Let's then determine
With the ancient of war on our proceedings.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: I shall attend you presently at your tent.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Sister, you'll go with us?

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: 'Tis most convenient; pray you, go with us.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Aside O, ho, I know the riddle.--I will go.

scene-body.stagedir: As they are going out, enter EDGAR disguised

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: If e'er your grace had speech with man so poor,
Hear me one word.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: I'll overtake you. Speak.

scene-body.stagedir: Exeunt all but ALBANY and EDGAR

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Before you fight the battle, ope this letter.
If you have victory, let the trumpet sound
For him that brought it: wretched though I seem,
I can produce a champion that will prove
What is avouched there. If you miscarry,
Your business of the world hath so an end,
And machination ceases. Fortune love you.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Stay till I have read the letter.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: I was forbid it.
When time shall serve, let but the herald cry,
And I'll appear again.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Why, fare thee well: I will o'erlook thy paper.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: The enemy's in view; draw up your powers.
Here is the guess of their true strength and forces
By diligent discovery; but your haste
Is now urged on you.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: We will greet the time.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: To both these sisters have I sworn my love;
Each jealous of the other, as the stung
Are of the adder. Which of them shall I take?
Both? one? or neither? Neither can be enjoy'd,
If both remain alive: to take the widow
Exasperates, makes mad her sister Goneril;
And hardly shall I carry out my side,
Her husband being alive. Now then we'll use
His countenance for the battle; which being done,
Let her who would be rid of him devise
His speedy taking off. As for the mercy
Which he intends to Lear and to Cordelia,
The battle done, and they within our power,
Shall never see his pardon; for my state
Stands on me to defend, not to debate.

scene.title: SCENE II. A field between the two camps.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Here, father, take the shadow of this tree
For your good host; pray that the right may thrive:
If ever I return to you again,
I'll bring you comfort.

speech.speaker: GLOUCESTER
speech.line: Grace go with you, sir!

scene-body.stagedir: Alarum and retreat within. Re-enter EDGAR

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Away, old man; give me thy hand; away!
King Lear hath lost, he and his daughter ta'en:
Give me thy hand; come on.

speech.speaker: GLOUCESTER
speech.line: No farther, sir; a man may rot even here.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: What, in ill thoughts again? Men must endure
Their going hence, even as their coming hither;
Ripeness is all: come on.

speech.speaker: GLOUCESTER
speech.line: And that's true too.

scene.title: SCENE III. The British camp near Dover.

scene-body.stagedir: Enter, in conquest, with drum and colours, EDMUND, KING LEAR and CORDELIA, prisoners; Captain, Soldiers, &c

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Some officers take them away: good guard,
Until their greater pleasures first be known
That are to censure them.

speech.speaker: CORDELIA
speech.line: We are not the first
Who, with best meaning, have incurr'd the worst.
For thee, oppressed king, am I cast down;
Myself could else out-frown false fortune's frown.
Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters?

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: No, no, no, no! Come, let's away to prison:
We two alone will sing like birds i' the cage:
When thou dost ask me blessing, I'll kneel down,
And ask of thee forgiveness: so we'll live,
And pray, and sing, and tell old tales, and laugh
At gilded butterflies, and hear poor rogues
Talk of court news; and we'll talk with them too,
Who loses and who wins; who's in, who's out;
And take upon's the mystery of things,
As if we were God's spies: and we'll wear out,
In a wall'd prison, packs and sects of great ones,
That ebb and flow by the moon.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Take them away.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: Upon such sacrifices, my Cordelia,
The gods themselves throw incense. Have I caught thee?
He that parts us shall bring a brand from heaven,
And fire us hence like foxes. Wipe thine eyes;
The good-years shall devour them, flesh and fell,
Ere they shall make us weep: we'll see 'em starve
first. Come.

scene-body.stagedir: Exeunt KING LEAR and CORDELIA, guarded

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Come hither, captain; hark.
Take thou this note;
go follow them to prison:
One step I have advanced thee; if thou dost
As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way
To noble fortunes: know thou this, that men
Are as the time is: to be tender-minded
Does not become a sword: thy great employment
Will not bear question; either say thou'lt do 't,
Or thrive by other means.

speech.speaker: Captain
speech.line: I'll do 't, my lord.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: About it; and write happy when thou hast done.
Mark, I say, instantly; and carry it so
As I have set it down.

speech.speaker: Captain
speech.line: I cannot draw a cart, nor eat dried oats;
If it be man's work, I'll do 't.

scene-body.stagedir: Flourish. Enter ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, another Captain, and Soldiers

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Sir, you have shown to-day your valiant strain,
And fortune led you well: you have the captives
That were the opposites of this day's strife:
We do require them of you, so to use them
As we shall find their merits and our safety
May equally determine.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Sir, I thought it fit
To send the old and miserable king
To some retention and appointed guard;
Whose age has charms in it, whose title more,
To pluck the common bosom on his side,
An turn our impress'd lances in our eyes
Which do command them. With him I sent the queen;
My reason all the same; and they are ready
To-morrow, or at further space, to appear
Where you shall hold your session. At this time
We sweat and bleed: the friend hath lost his friend;
And the best quarrels, in the heat, are cursed
By those that feel their sharpness:
The question of Cordelia and her father
Requires a fitter place.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Sir, by your patience,
I hold you but a subject of this war,
Not as a brother.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: That's as we list to grace him.
Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded,
Ere you had spoke so far. He led our powers;
Bore the commission of my place and person;
The which immediacy may well stand up,
And call itself your brother.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Not so hot:
In his own grace he doth exalt himself,
More than in your addition.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: In my rights,
By me invested, he compeers the best.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: That were the most, if he should husband you.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Jesters do oft prove prophets.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Holla, holla!
That eye that told you so look'd but a-squint.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Lady, I am not well; else I should answer
From a full-flowing stomach. General,
Take thou my soldiers, prisoners, patrimony;
Dispose of them, of me; the walls are thine:
Witness the world, that I create thee here
My lord and master.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Mean you to enjoy him?

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: The let-alone lies not in your good will.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Nor in thine, lord.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Half-blooded fellow, yes.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: To EDMUND Let the drum strike, and prove my title thine.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Stay yet; hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee
On capital treason; and, in thine attaint,
This gilded serpent
For your claim, fair sister,
I bar it in the interest of my wife:
'Tis she is sub-contracted to this lord,
And I, her husband, contradict your bans.
If you will marry, make your loves to me,
My lady is bespoke.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: An interlude!

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Thou art arm'd, Gloucester: let the trumpet sound:
If none appear to prove upon thy head
Thy heinous, manifest, and many treasons,
There is my pledge;
I'll prove it on thy heart,
Ere I taste bread, thou art in nothing less
Than I have here proclaim'd thee.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: Sick, O, sick!

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Aside If not, I'll ne'er trust medicine.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: There's my exchange:
what in the world he is
That names me traitor, villain-like he lies:
Call by thy trumpet: he that dares approach,
On him, on you, who not? I will maintain
My truth and honour firmly.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: A herald, ho!

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: A herald, ho, a herald!

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Trust to thy single virtue; for thy soldiers,
All levied in my name, have in my name
Took their discharge.

speech.speaker: REGAN
speech.line: My sickness grows upon me.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: She is not well; convey her to my tent.
Come hither, herald,--Let the trumpet sound,
And read out this.

speech.speaker: Captain
speech.line: Sound, trumpet!

speech.speaker: Herald
speech.line: Reads 'If any man of quality or degree within
the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund,
supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold
traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the
trumpet: he is bold in his defence.'

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Sound!

speech.speaker: Herald
speech.line: Again!

speech.speaker: Herald
speech.line: Again!

scene-body.stagedir: Enter EDGAR, at the third sound, armed, with a trumpet before him

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Ask him his purposes, why he appears
Upon this call o' the trumpet.

speech.speaker: Herald
speech.line: What are you?
Your name, your quality? and why you answer
This present summons?

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Know, my name is lost;
By treason's tooth bare-gnawn and canker-bit:
Yet am I noble as the adversary
I come to cope.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Which is that adversary?

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: What's he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester?

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Himself: what say'st thou to him?

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Draw thy sword,
That, if my speech offend a noble heart,
Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine.
Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours,
My oath, and my profession: I protest,
Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence,
Despite thy victor sword and fire-new fortune,
Thy valour and thy heart, thou art a traitor;
False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father;
Conspirant 'gainst this high-illustrious prince;
And, from the extremest upward of thy head
To the descent and dust below thy foot,
A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou 'No,'
This sword, this arm, and my best spirits, are bent
To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak,
Thou liest.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: In wisdom I should ask thy name;
But, since thy outside looks so fair and warlike,
And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes,
What safe and nicely I might well delay
By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn:
Back do I toss these treasons to thy head;
With the hell-hated lie o'erwhelm thy heart;
Which, for they yet glance by and scarcely bruise,
This sword of mine shall give them instant way,
Where they shall rest for ever. Trumpets, speak!

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Save him, save him!

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: This is practise, Gloucester:
By the law of arms thou wast not bound to answer
An unknown opposite; thou art not vanquish'd,
But cozen'd and beguiled.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Shut your mouth, dame,
Or with this paper shall I stop it: Hold, sir:
Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil:
No tearing, lady: I perceive you know it.

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Say, if I do, the laws are mine, not thine:
Who can arraign me for't.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Most monstrous! oh!
Know'st thou this paper?

speech.speaker: GONERIL
speech.line: Ask me not what I know.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Go after her: she's desperate; govern her.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: What you have charged me with, that have I done;
And more, much more; the time will bring it out:
'Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou
That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,
I do forgive thee.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Let's exchange charity.
I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund;
If more, the more thou hast wrong'd me.
My name is Edgar, and thy father's son.
The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices
Make instruments to plague us:
The dark and vicious place where thee he got
Cost him his eyes.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Thou hast spoken right, 'tis true;
The wheel is come full circle: I am here.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Methought thy very gait did prophesy
A royal nobleness: I must embrace thee:
Let sorrow split my heart, if ever I
Did hate thee or thy father!

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Worthy prince, I know't.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Where have you hid yourself?
How have you known the miseries of your father?

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale;
And when 'tis told, O, that my heart would burst!
The bloody proclamation to escape,
That follow'd me so near,--O, our lives' sweetness!
That we the pain of death would hourly die
Rather than die at once!--taught me to shift
Into a madman's rags; to assume a semblance
That very dogs disdain'd: and in this habit
Met I my father with his bleeding rings,
Their precious stones new lost: became his guide,
Led him, begg'd for him, saved him from despair;
Never,--O fault!--reveal'd myself unto him,
Until some half-hour past, when I was arm'd:
Not sure, though hoping, of this good success,
I ask'd his blessing, and from first to last
Told him my pilgrimage: but his flaw'd heart,
Alack, too weak the conflict to support!
'Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief,
Burst smilingly.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: This speech of yours hath moved me,
And shall perchance do good: but speak you on;
You look as you had something more to say.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: If there be more, more woeful, hold it in;
For I am almost ready to dissolve,
Hearing of this.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: This would have seem'd a period
To such as love not sorrow; but another,
To amplify too much, would make much more,
And top extremity.
Whilst I was big in clamour came there in a man,
Who, having seen me in my worst estate,
Shunn'd my abhorr'd society; but then, finding
Who 'twas that so endured, with his strong arms
He fastened on my neck, and bellow'd out
As he'ld burst heaven; threw him on my father;
Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him
That ever ear received: which in recounting
His grief grew puissant and the strings of life
Began to crack: twice then the trumpets sounded,
And there I left him tranced.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: But who was this?

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Kent, sir, the banish'd Kent; who in disguise
Follow'd his enemy king, and did him service
Improper for a slave.

scene-body.stagedir: Enter a Gentleman, with a bloody knife

speech.speaker: Gentleman
speech.line: Help, help, O, help!

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: What kind of help?

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Speak, man.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: What means that bloody knife?

speech.speaker: Gentleman
speech.line: 'Tis hot, it smokes;
It came even from the heart of--O, she's dead!

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Who dead? speak, man.

speech.speaker: Gentleman
speech.line: Your lady, sir, your lady: and her sister
By her is poisoned; she hath confess'd it.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: I was contracted to them both: all three
Now marry in an instant.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Here comes Kent.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead:
This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble,
Touches us not with pity.
O, is this he?
The time will not allow the compliment
Which very manners urges.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: I am come
To bid my king and master aye good night:
Is he not here?

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Great thing of us forgot!
Speak, Edmund, where's the king? and where's Cordelia?
See'st thou this object, Kent?

scene-body.stagedir: The bodies of GONERIL and REGAN are brought in

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Alack, why thus?

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Yet Edmund was beloved:
The one the other poison'd for my sake,
And after slew herself.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Even so. Cover their faces.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: I pant for life: some good I mean to do,
Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send,
Be brief in it, to the castle; for my writ
Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia:
Nay, send in time.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Run, run, O, run!

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: To who, my lord? Who hath the office? send
Thy token of reprieve.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: Well thought on: take my sword,
Give it the captain.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Haste thee, for thy life.

speech.speaker: EDMUND
speech.line: He hath commission from thy wife and me
To hang Cordelia in the prison, and
To lay the blame upon her own despair,
That she fordid herself.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.

scene-body.stagedir: Re-enter KING LEAR, with CORDELIA dead in his arms; EDGAR, Captain, and others following

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones:
Had I your tongues and eyes, I'ld use them so
That heaven's vault should crack. She's gone for ever!
I know when one is dead, and when one lives;
She's dead as earth. Lend me a looking-glass;
If that her breath will mist or stain the stone,
Why, then she lives.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Is this the promised end

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Or image of that horror?

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Fall, and cease!

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: This feather stirs; she lives! if it be so,
It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows
That ever I have felt.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Kneeling O my good master!

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: Prithee, away.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: 'Tis noble Kent, your friend.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all!
I might have saved her; now she's gone for ever!
Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha!
What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft,
Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman.
I kill'd the slave that was a-hanging thee.

speech.speaker: Captain
speech.line: 'Tis true, my lords, he did.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: Did I not, fellow?
I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion
I would have made them skip: I am old now,
And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you?
Mine eyes are not o' the best: I'll tell you straight.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: If fortune brag of two she loved and hated,
One of them we behold.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent?

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: The same,
Your servant Kent: Where is your servant Caius?

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: He's a good fellow, I can tell you that;
He'll strike, and quickly too: he's dead and rotten.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: No, my good lord; I am the very man,--

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: I'll see that straight.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: That, from your first of difference and decay,
Have follow'd your sad steps.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: You are welcome hither.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Nor no man else: all's cheerless, dark, and deadly.
Your eldest daughters have fordone them selves,
And desperately are dead.

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: Ay, so I think.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: He knows not what he says: and vain it is
That we present us to him.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Very bootless.

speech.speaker: Captain
speech.line: Edmund is dead, my lord.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: That's but a trifle here.
You lords and noble friends, know our intent.
What comfort to this great decay may come
Shall be applied: for us we will resign,
During the life of this old majesty,
To him our absolute power:
you, to your rights:
With boot, and such addition as your honours
Have more than merited. All friends shall taste
The wages of their virtue, and all foes
The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!

speech.speaker: KING LEAR
speech.line: And my poor fool is hang'd! No, no, no life!
Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life,
And thou no breath at all? Thou'lt come no more,
Never, never, never, never, never!
Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir.
Do you see this? Look on her, look, her lips,
Look there, look there!

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: He faints! My lord, my lord!

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Break, heart; I prithee, break!

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: Look up, my lord.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much
That would upon the rack of this tough world
Stretch him out longer.

speech.speaker: EDGAR
speech.line: He is gone, indeed.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: The wonder is, he hath endured so long:
He but usurp'd his life.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: Bear them from hence. Our present business
Is general woe.
Friends of my soul, you twain
Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.

speech.speaker: KENT
speech.line: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go;
My master calls me, I must not say no.

speech.speaker: ALBANY
speech.line: The weight of this sad time we must obey;
Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.
The oldest hath borne most: we that are young
Shall never see so much, nor live so long.
